references.paper_title: Towards credible visual model interpretation with path attribution
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the current work as it also focuses on model interpretation methods and addresses issues related to visual model interpretation using path attribution, which is relevant to the integrated gradients methods discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Two-stage least squares estimation of average causal effects in models with variable treatment intensity
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the instrumental variable method used in this paper, which is crucial to address the problem of unobservable confounders in feature attribution.

references.paper_title: The effect of age at school entry on educational attainment: an application of instrumental variables with moments from two samples
references.reason: This paper is an important application of the instrumental variable method, which this paper builds upon to mitigate the impact of unobservable confounders.

references.paper_title: A unified approach to interpreting model predictions
references.reason: This paper introduces the SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) method, which is a widely used feature attribution method that is discussed and compared against in this paper.

This paper introduces the Integrated Gradients method, another widely used feature attribution method compared against in this paper, which is particularly relevant to the discussion on deep learning models.
